definition: to adapt to circumstances

classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
surname Quan
authority/power/right/(literary) to weigh/expedient/temporary
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to do whatever is expedient
to conduct oneself in society
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
doctrine of the mean/moderation in all things
way of life/attitude/modus operandi
(idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
to handle affairs/to deal with

receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
